column4: when I return from suspend, I can't start new processes (for example if i try to start chromium it says "Starting Chromium.." and then it just closes
and when I boot up, half the time it does this thing where I have to login at a prompt and wait like a minute for ubuntu to start up .. it's so annoying! please help
nobody knows how to fix these problems?
is natty stable?
explain the problem a bit more please
yes, natty is classed as stable
i dont know what else to say.  after i've suspended I turn the computer back on and i can use any programs that are open but i can't start new ones because they just fail to open
suspend can be quite buggy in Linux in general
they get swapped out to disk
it used to work fine on my laptop when i was using 10.04 LTS 32-bit but when i switched to 64-bit it's not working anymore
I can understand that
in that case, is it likely it will be functional if i go to natty 32-bit?
no promises, suspend depends on many component
what about the hanging at bootup?
what hanging at boot
instead of going straight into ubuntu it loads up a black screen with prompt asking for login: -- so i login and wait like a minute before ubuntu magically starts
it's at least a full minute
if you don't login, does it start X on it's own ?
i never waited that long without logging in, I don't know
try it
i guess it probably would since sometimes it doesnt do that at all
check it
i will try it and report back
thank you !
